Half-Life - One of the most iconic, revolutionary and groundbreaking games of all time, then and now. 

The original Half-Life and it's expansions are by far some of my all time favourite games, I'd even venture to say that they are in fact my favourite FPS games even to this day, Half-Life defeats any modern FPS game (and Halo games) no competition.

I don't know where to begin when it comes to listing my favourite things about this game, there are hardly any faults with it at all. Sure, the graphics may be questionable to some by todays standards, but for it's time they were groundbreaking. A vast selection of weapons, areas, an amazing storyline and puzzles make this one really brilliant single-player experience. The Hazard course by extension is also the most well implemented tutorial I've seen in a game.

This is a game that I could play for many more years to come and still enjoy it by setting myself challenges. The only thing that would improve upon Half-Life (and Opposing Force, even Blue Shift) would be to create a list of acheivements just so there is some extra singleplayer playability, but other than that, there is nothing out there in the FPS world that even comes close to matching Half-Life, and I doubt that there ever will be. 

Valve are amazing story tellers, this is evident in essentially every title that they release with the exception of one or two more silly games and I (like everybody else) eagerly await the upcoming Half-Life titles. It is torture to make somebody wait so long for something so promising. 

To cut a review short, this game is amazing and it always will be. It is well worth the full retail price and so are it's expansions (even though Blue Shift is extremely short), so pick it up and you won't regret it. Period.
What can I say that hasn't been said? It's practically timeless, and if you don't have it already then... what the hell's wrong with you?

By far my most favourite game, it is the ultimate classic game in my opinion. The dated graphics still seem so natural, they add to the game in my opinion, as well it is probably one of the most atmospheric games I have ever played, I found myself lost in it for hours on end. It has a fantastic soundtrack the gameplay still holds up just fine. It offers enough of a challenge and is a must have for any gamer. Anyone who does not own this game has to go and buy it as soon as they can, I would pay more than it is on steam full price just for experience this game offered me.

What can I say, it's freakin Half Life, man.  This game came out in '98 and it still holds up today.  Yes, the graphics look like shit by today's standards, but the gameplay is great, the world is super interesting, and the story is pretty damn good.   If the grapics are too ugly for you to look at, then I reccomend Black mesa or HL Source.  One of the best, and for once, the Metascore is not bullshit like a lot of games, this deserves its 96/100.  I give it a 10/10, one of my favorite.  If you haven't played this, then you need to do yourself a favor and play it.  Come on, it is only $10, that's the equivalent of a small meal at a fast food resturaunt.  Spare yourself 1 small meal to buy this game.

Old age has not diminished this game's value at all. Although there isn't much story or character interaction, you're motivated to keep playing just see how far and how disastrous the consequences of the incident was...and whether you can do anything about it. 

Even if you played Half-Life 2 first, this is still worth playing because the gameplay is essentially the same (minus the Gravity Gun) and, of course, you get exposed to the backstory.  Difficulty is adjustable so I recommend this game to all FPS gamers and Half-Life fans.

Ok... yet me just say, I like it. The original Half-Life is still good to this day, in my opinion. It probably has to do with me loving the hell out of retro games.

Pros: -The gameplay is good. I do have some problems with it, but that will be in the Cons section.
-Good story. While there is no major characters other than you, Gordon Freeman, I do still like to look at the NPCs. Some remind me of characters for Half-Life 2. The first guard I met said "Meet me later, I'll buy you a beer." I instantly thought of Barney. Sadly, it was not Barney, as he was in a different part of Black Mesa (Barney's "About that beer I owed ya." line from HL2 is a reference to that exact line the guards say to Freeman). The story isn't too obvious, but trust me, when I first found out the military was killing EVERYONE, it was a shock.
-I f**king loved the opening. Not the train ride, that was poop, the whole being with your coworkers stuff. I also liked it in Blue Shift.

Cons:-Graphics do not hold up today. Compared to the amazing looks of Half-Life 2 (and new games like Titanfall) it's graphics suck. It looks like original Playstation. Yes, I know it came out in 1998.
-Gameplay is weird! You run WAY too fast. The only way to slow your ass down is to press Shift to walk or crouch down. It is really hard to walk on narrow paths. Jumping onto ladders is weird too. If you keep pressing SPACE you don't grab on. That can be a problem.
-Headcrabs are too F**KING STRONG! It takes 2 pistol shots to kill them. That's not bad. Then it takes like 4 or 5 hits with the crowbar to kill them. Um.. isn't the crowbar a headcrab's weakness? The tiny knife from Opposing Force insa-kills them! WTF?!
-You get lost too much, too fast. I found myself revisting corridor after corridor. Everything looks the same!
-Finnally, it gets too hard, way too damn fast! I just got to the part where you first meet the soldiers. I'm on medium difficulty and I barely survived the horror section of the game. I am on 30 or so health, no armor, and I meet a soldier. I die. I respawn right in front of him. I kill him, then I get healed by a scientist. I go to next room. I get killed by 3 soldiers. TOO HARD, TOO FAST!

Overall, I reccomend getting the HAlf-Life Anthology. 4 games for $15. It is still fun, but unless you want a challenge, play on Easy.

How do I review a game like Half Life? Well let's start by saying it is one of the best shooters of all time. It may seem a little dated but the gameplay and story kept me hooked all the way through. The multiplayer in this game is really fast paced and you are always fighting. If you think the guns and textures don't look good you have the option to turn on HD textures from a 2001 update. I love this game and I totally recommend Half Life and Half Life: Source along with Black Mesa, a mod for Half Life 2. I give this game 10/10!

In comparison to modern games, the graphics weren't the best (obviously) and the plot felt pretty empty. Nonetheless, lots of things were a nice and fun challenge and I really enjoyed playing the game.

Half Life ist und bleibt ein Klassiker. Früher, so wie heute, gehört dieses Spiel einfach auf jeden Rechner. Die Story ist packend und das Gameplay ist wunderbar. Wer gerne ein packendes Spiel haben möchte, ist mit diesem Spiel auf alle Fälle auf der richtigen Seite.

The graphics are outdated, but the gameplay still holds. The gameplay is absolutely incredible, the story is interesting, and the controls are tighter then the skinny jeans I tried to wear in 7th grade. Exciting and thrilling despite the graphical limitations. It's almost difficult to believe this was made in 1998, well if the character models didn't look like they had been modeled out of clay and then dropped multiple times. I especially love the health and suit mechanics. It may be old, but it gives you a truly epic feel. Boss fights though scarce are some of my favorites. Thrilling, epic, awesome are all words that could be used to describe this game. I thought I had seen the real experience with the Black Mesa Half-Life 2 Mod, but I was mistaken. There are some differences, and the mod doesn't have the same atmosphere as the original. The original game is easier anyway and I respect that this game is one of the best out there and highly recommend that you play it if you get a chance. It works on even low-rate computers like mine and is way underpriced if you ask me. The music is great, and the level design is some of the best that I have ever seen. Among my few minor complaints are that the friendly NPCs are terrible at following, limited voice actor variety, crouch jumping is annoying, and what you need to do is sometimes nearly impossible to figure out without lots of trial and error. All in all one of my personal favorite games. 11 snarks out of 10.

[i]„Jdete pozdě, pane Freeman.“[/i]

Dlouho jsem váhal, jestli si mám tuhle hru po letech znovu zahrát. Moje vzpomínky na ni, byly zahaleny v závoji nostalgie, a já měl obavy z jeho rozhrnutí. Unesu pohled na její hranaté tvary? Co když mi bude připadat hloupá a nudná? Nebudu mít chuť naše setkání po několika minutách ukončit, a se slzou v oku si připustit, že mě paměť milosrdně klamala? Ale přesto jsem sebral odvahu a hru spustil.

Po chvilce nervózního přešlapování v prázdném vagónu, zahlédnu Barneyho jak buší na dveře. S úsměvem na tváři mu mávám na pozdrav, ale nevidí mě. Nemám mu to za zlé, má svých starostí dost a dnes ho také čeká těžký den. O něco později se míjíme s panem G-Manem. Uctivě se ukloním, ale pan G-Man mě ignoruje a jen si utáhne kravatu a opráší oblek, prostě profesionál. Po příjezdu na pracoviště, už mají události rychlý spád. V duchu se omlouvám svým kolegům za nepříjemnosti které jim způsobím, ale co se má stát, stane se... V té době už mě hra natolik pohltila, že jsem na svoje počáteční obavy úplně zapomněl. A ve chvíli, kdy jsem v dlani opět sevřel páčidlo, už nebylo pochyb – tahle hra je pořád skvělá.

Pokud jste tuto hru zatím nehráli, pak z předchozích řádků asi moc moudří nejste. Pojďme si tedy říct, na co se můžete těšit. Hrajete za vědce jménem Gordon Freeman, který přežil katastrofální následky nepovedeného experimentu. Z vašeho pokusu o únik z výzkumného komplexu Black Mesa se ovšem brzy stane boj o holý život.

Hru lze označit jako sci-fi střílečku ze staré školy, která vyšla v roce 1998. Automatické léčení a systém krytí, tady proto nenajdete. V boji budete moci využívat různé typy zbraní, ať už klasické, jako je pistole nebo brokovnice, tak i méně obvyklé. Některé z nich jsou velice nápadité a užijete si s nimi spoustu zábavy, nebudu vám ale kazit překvapení.

Velice rozmanití jsou také nepřátelé, kteří vám budou stát v cestě. Snad neprozradím příliš mnoho, když řeknu že kromě lidských protivníků, si na vás budou brousit zuby také mimozemští tvorové. Lidé jsou navíc v boji velice obratní a často mě překvapilo, jak chytře se přemisťují a pohotově reagují na moje jednání. Dovolím si tvrdit, že vývojáři z Valve, v tomto směru předběhli svojí dobu o několik let.

Jedinou věcí, která mi kazila zážitek ze hry, jsou přeskakovací pasáže. Přiznám se, že jsem při opakovaných pádech do hlubin, občas zle nadával. Možná jsem ale jenom nešikovný, a ostatní hráči, tyhle úseky překonávají s ladností kamzíka.

Jestli si tedy chcete zahrát střílečku, která se nesmazatelně zapsala do herní historie, pak neváhejte. Hraje se pořád skvěle.

A brilliantly told story through the eyes of Phd Gordan Freeman, was a major stepping stone and success to valves games, gained a massive following and is still played today, if your looking for an old experience like none other I'd recommend having a play at HL, or if you'd rather flash graphics with more realistic combat then maybe have a go at the reinvisioned version of HL(BlackMesa) a project of several years buy a garage group of individuals who were inspired by the classic to recreate and reinvent it using the Source engine.  I would say that BlackMesa is a tribute to the success of HL so if your after something new but classic at the same time, give BlackMesa a try.

I LOVE IT

I wish I could say I love this game, and that it is a classic, yada yada yada. But frankly, its awful. 

The graphics are so bad that I don't even know what I'm looking at. Its not a "ew this game isn't up to modern standards" kind of thing. Its a "I can't play this because I can't see anything" type of thing. 

Another problem is glitchyness. I got stuck in the ground over and over again, exploded randomly, or got clipped into objects. the game was literally unplayable for large sections. 

Don't expect Half-Life 2 standards of story and characters. There essentially aren't any likable characters, because all there is is generic lab assistants or generic soldiers (each have a few lines.) There isn't really any story either. The game is 100% shoot em up all the way though, unlike Half-Life 2 where you stopped to isten to likable NPC's or watch cutscenes. This means there is no reason to care about what happens and no sense of tension or urgency. That reminds me, there isn't even a proper soundtrack to set the mood. 

Basically, this game is DOOM 3.
A classic, buy it if you don't have it yet.

Half-LIfe was the third FPS game I had EVER played. The first was Doom 2, the second was Chex Quest (if you know what I mean, then please know that you are my best friend for forever) and this gem was the third. I say this because even next to those two classics of the genre, this is amazing. Even by current shooter standards, it's amazing. It's fun, a bit challenging, story-driven, immersive (I can't tell you how many times I've jumped back from lunging headcrabs) and allows you to play as the world's best educated mute.

Making The Decision to put down your beloved Half-Life

Perhaps the kindest thing you can do for Half-Life that is so sick or so severely injured that he or she will never recover normal health is to have your veterinarian induce its death quietly and humanely through euthanasia. Your decision to have your Half-Life euthanatized is a serious one and seldom easy to make.

How will I know when?

If Half-Life can no longer do with you and your family the things he or she once enjoyed, if your Half-Life cannot respond to you in the usual ways, or if there is more pain than pleasure in his or her life, you may need to consider euthanasia. Likewise, if Half-Life is terminally ill or critically injured, or if the financial or emotional cost of treatment is beyond your means, euthanasia may be a valid option.
Your veterinarian understands attachment to Half-Life, and can examine and evaluate your Half-Lifes condition, estimate your Half-Lifes chances for recovery, and discuss potential disabilities and long-term problems. He or she can explain the medical options and possible outcomes. Because your veterinarian cannot make the euthanasia decision for you, it is important that you fully understand your Half-Lifes condition. If there is any part of the diagnosis or the implications for your Half-Lifes future that you don't understand, ask to have it explained again. Rarely will the situation require an immediate decision. Usually, you will have time to review the facts before making your decision.

As you make your decision, you may wish to discuss the care of the remains of your Half-Lifes body with your family and veterinarian. You have several options, and your veterinarian can provide information about burial, cremation, or other alternatives.

What should I do?

Your relationship with your Half-Life is special, and you are responsible for its care and welfare. Eventually, many owners are faced with making life or death decisions for their Half-Lifes. Such a decision may become necessary for the welfare of the game and for you and your family.
A decision concerning euthanasia may be one of the most difficult decisions you will ever make regarding your Half-Life. Your decision is a personal one, but it need not be a solitary one. Your veterinarian and your family and friends can assist and support you. Consider not only what is best for your Half-Life, but also what is best for you and your family. Quality of life is important for Half-Lifes and people alike.

What if the game is healthy?

Euthanasia might be necessary if a Half-Life has become vicious, dangerous, or unmanageable. However, some undesirable and abnormal behavior can be changed. Economic, emotional, and space limitations or changes in lifestyle also may force an owner to consider euthanasia of a game, but it is better to find another solution or an alternative home for these Half-Lifes. Euthanasia should be considered only when another alternative is not available.
How do I tell my family?

Family members usually are already aware of a Half-Lifes problems. However, you should review with them the information you have received from your veterinarian. Long-term medical care can be a burden that you and your family may be unable to bear emotionally or financially, and this should be discussed openly and honestly. Encourage family members to express their thoughts and feelings. Even if you have reached a decision, it is important that family members, especially children, have their feelings considered.
